Ognjen Jaramaz (Serbian: Огњен Јарамаз; born September 1, 1995) is a Serbian professional basketball player for Mega Leks of the Basketball League of Serbia. Standing at 1.93 m (6 ft 4 in),[1] he plays at the point guard position.

Contents

  • 1 Professional career
    • 1.1 NBA
  • 2 Personal life
  • 3 References
  • 4 External links

Professional career[edit]

He began playing basketball in a hometown based club Napredak Kruševac where he stayed until 2006. He then moved to Partizan, playing for the youth categories.

In the summer of 2013, he signed a contract with Mega Vizura. He was loaned to Smederevo 1953 for the 2013–14 season, where he made his professional debut. He returned to Mega Vizura in the summer of 2014.

NBA[edit]

On June 22, 2017, Jaramaz was selected with the 58th overall pick in the 2017 NBA draft by the New York Knicks.[2] He played for the Knicks during 2017 NBA Summer League.

Personal life[edit]

His older brother is Nemanja, also a professional basketball player.[3]
